channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Kamala Harris' media silence: Is ignoring the press more damaging than Trump's attacks?
item.description: Bill Maher raised concerns about Vice President Kamala Harris' lack of media engagement compared to Donald Trump’s antagonistic approach. Maher suggested that her silence signals that the press is irrelevant. Harris has not held major press conferences since her nomination, prompting criticism for her lack of transparency and willingness to engage with the public and press.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US reaffirms support for Rohingya on 7th anniversary of Burma genocide
item.description: US secretary of state Antony Blinken addressed the ongoing crisis in Burma, highlighting the plight of the Rohingya, and marking the seventh anniversary of their genocide. Blinken emphasized the US's commitment to humanitarian assistance, with nearly $2.4 billion contributed over seven years, and supporting the Rohingya in seeking justice and accountability for the atrocities committed against them.

item.title: Winter in August? Unseasonal snow and rain surprise west coast, disrupt travel and festivals
item.description: A rare cold weather system from the Gulf of Alaska brought unexpected snow to California and the Pacific Northwest in August. Highways were closed, and unusual snowfall was reported in places like Lassen Volcanic National Park, Minaret Vista, and Tioga Pass, disrupting travel and affecting events like the Burning Man festival in Nevada.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hailey Welch seeks to move beyond viral fame as 'Hawk Tuah girl': 'I'd rather just be known as ...'
item.description: Hailey Welch, known for her viral "Hawk Tuah Girl" persona on TikTok, expressed her desire to be recognized beyond the nickname on the debut episode of West Wilson's dating show. She shared her aspirations to venture into podcasting and reality TV, aiming to redefine her public image.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seattle-Tacoma airport hit by 'possible cyberattack': Several flights delayed
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle to return to UK with Prince Harry? What is her condition?
item.description: Meghan Markle has reportedly set a condition for her return to England with Prince Harry, demanding a secure and separate place to live. Their request follows their eviction from Frogmore Cottage. The couple's focus on security and residency remains key, as Prince Harry recently appealed a High Court decision on their UK security arrangements.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Matthew Perry's death: What 'Friends' actor's demise exposes about the life of celebrity assistants
item.description: Matthew Perry's tragic death on October 28, 2023, has highlighted the pressures faced by celebrity assistants. Perry's assistant, Kenny Iwamasa, confessed to injecting him with a fatal dose of ketamine. His arrest underscores the dangerous demands placed on assistants, who often face ethical dilemmas. This case reveals the challenging reality behind seemingly glamorous roles.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: French Police arrests suspect behind fire attack on synagogue
item.description: French police arrested a man on Sunday suspected of setting fires and causing an explosion at a synagogue in La Grande-Motte, southern France. The attack injured a police officer and involved propane gas, with five people in the synagogue unharmed. Authorities denounce the act as an attempt to kill Jews amid rising antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Post-Democratic Convention: What's next for Donald Trump in US elections?
item.description: With the Democratic National Convention concluded, Donald Trump faced challenges in his campaign against Kamala Harris. He held events in key battleground states, balancing personal attacks and policy discussions. Trump attempted to address abortion concerns and received an endorsement from Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Trump’s strategy focused on countering Harris’ rising popularity and reconciling with Republicans he had clashed with.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Defying norms: Matrimonial app brings modern matchmaking to Pakistan
item.description: In Lahore, an event hosted by UK-based matrimonial app Muzz offered a unique space for young singles to meet, breaking away from Pakistan's traditional parent-arranged marriage norms. The gathering, a first in the country, aimed to reduce the stigma around dating apps in this conservative nation, providing a safe environment for personal connections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel launches pre-emptive strikes at Lebanon to avert 'large-scale' Hezbollah attack
item.description: The Israeli military conducted pre-emptive strikes in Lebanon following detected preparations for large-scale attacks by Hezbollah. This action was described as self-defense to neutralize threats from the militant group. The strike targeted Hezbollah arms depots and aimed to prevent potential attacks on Israeli civilians. The conflict has seen near-daily exchanges along the Israel-Lebanon border.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'A sick old man from Red Square who ... ': What Ukraine President Zelenskyy said about Putin in I-Day speech
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy of Ukraine announced a new long-range drone missile named Palianytsia on the country's 33rd Independence Day. The weapon, targeting Russian refineries and airfields, marked a significant development. The announcement coincided with heightened tensions involving Ukrainian incursions into Russian territory and reciprocal prisoner exchanges between Ukraine and Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sydney mass stabbing: Four injured in latest knife attack following car crash, police officer among victims
item.description: Early Sunday morning, a stabbing attack in Sydney's Engadine left four people, including a police officer, injured following a car crash. The suspect has been apprehended, and there is no ongoing threat, according to authorities. This incident is part of a troubling series of knife assaults in the city this year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korean Olympic medalists under Kim Jong Un’s wrath for ‘unpatriotic’ smiles with South Korean rivals
item.description: North Korean table-tennis players Kim Kum-yong and Ri Jong-sik faced investigation after their Olympic victory photos with South Korean athletes caused controversy in North Korea. The regime, known for strictly controlling foreign interactions, subjected them to a month-long ideological assessment to realign with state-approved values. The images, which captured a rare moment of sportsmanship between athletes from warring nations, went viral worldwide.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: BNP: Scrap Hasina government's pact with India
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) demanded the cancellation of agreements signed with India over the last 15 years under Sheikh Hasina's administration, labeling them as 'secret' and 'unjust'. BNP's Ruhul Kabir Rizvi called for the interim government to revoke these deals, claiming they compromised Bangladesh's independence and sovereignty. The stance conflicts with foreign affairs adviser Md Touhid Hossain's position.

item.title: 'Strong enemies, opponents': China shifts military focus amid mounting challenges
item.description: China's military, directed by President Xi Jinping, shifted focus to prepare for conflicts against powerful adversaries. Emphasizing national sovereignty and security, Xi called for enhancing the strategic ability of the People’s Liberation Army (PLA). Defense official Miao Hua supported this shift amidst geopolitical tensions and rising threats, emphasizing the importance of military readiness and strategic clarity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Starliner to return empty, SpaceX to fly back the crew
item.description: NASA chose SpaceX to return U.S. astronauts from the ISS after Boeing faced major technical issues with its capsule. Boeing's Starliner will now return uncrewed. NASA administrator Bill Nelson emphasized safety, recalling past shuttle losses. Despite this setback, Nelson remains confident in future crewed Starliner missions.

item.title: What we know about the knife attack in Germany that killed 3
Israeli airstrikes kill dozens in Gaza ahead of ceasefire talks
item.description: Several Israeli airstrikes in southern Gaza resulted in the deaths of at least three dozen Palestinians, including 11 members of a family. The strikes targeted areas in Khan Younis and Rafah. Discussions on a potential ceasefire involving officials from the US, Egypt, and Qatar were underway in Cairo, with talks set to continue on Sunday.

item.title: Bangladesh's worst floods in decades leave 5 million stranded
item.description: Five million people in Bangladesh were stranded by severe floods in low-lying areas, with the death toll rising to 15. Strong currents washed away river embankments as five rivers faced the worst flooding since 2018. Eleven districts were affected, complicating rescue efforts significantly. The government rushed food and emergency supplies, opening 3,176 shelters.
